item.title: Many unfilled potholes Hartley lane between Minataur turning in the road to the seven springs roundabout, 5th March
item.description:
As above. You sends a team of 2 people out and they fill in some but not all of the previously marked potholes. The white paint fades away by the time they come so they don't fill them all. 75 yds of this road needs resurfacing. It is beyond repair. 2 shock absorbers, 2 tyres and my car is in the garage facing another Â£550 for pothole damage. Hansa garage cheltenham if you wish to phone. please come and sort this mess out properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartley Lane, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole of Priors Road is now a major hazard - potholes, craters, dips and ridges all along the road in all directions. Needs to be fully resurfaced NOW!, 5th March
item.description:
Between the junction by the cemetery and the junction at Prestbury Road - completely un-driveable and still not being prioritised! This is an absolute disgrace and Glos Highways should be ashamed of themselves, especially as it seems other, side roads are being prioritised - this is a main road and used by large amounts of traffic, including buses - SORT THIS AS A MATTER OF URGENCY!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Welland Lodge Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More daft signage, 5th March

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Shipton, Cotswold

item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Roadwork traffic light operator, 5th March
item.description:
- The raised pavement is currently undergoing repairs and the work has been held up due to bad weather conditions. - The traffic signals are set badly, I have received reports of traffic coming from the B4070 being backed up to the Fostons Ash because they only showed green for a few seconds. - Birdlip woodyard entrance is opposite the works and access is awkward whilst the works are being carried out. At the beginning, the signal foreman allowed vehicular access to and from the yard from Birdlip village. The current operator is prohibiting access to and from the yard from the Birdlip village direction. This means that the woodyard drivers have to turn away from the village incurring a 12 mile detour. It also means that the woodyard is losing most of its trade because clients are being denied access. - These complaints have been brought to my attention over the last two weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Birdlip, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
